posts.title: Trump signs executive order directing federal funding cuts to PBS and NPR
top_comments: What is the point of having a Congress when one person can so completely change the course of so many things?
Back in my day, the executive’s job was to *execute* the laws enacted by the legislature, not undermine them.
Republicans have given up the legislative branch completely and are trying to help weaken the judicial as well. Pathetic. They are all worthless cunts.
The good news is apparently NPR gets about one percent of its budget from the feds. This will largely hurt public tv and radio in less affluent states.
So basically this means gov censorship to things they don’t agree with. Let’s not pretend this is anything but that.
Republicans in Congress are the chair facing the bed in the hotel room.
Congress approved this funding in the ‘60s. You can’t just EO that away. More performative nonsense from Dementia Don

I was reading an article in CNN about this, in which it was cited that Republicans were complaining that PBS programs have a "liberal" bias.  What a crock of shit.  I'd been listening to PBS Newshour podcast for the past few months and it's been such a breath of fresh air.  It's nearly an hour and ad-free, so they can really delve into stories.  Their political coverage is especially good, and they always have conservatives on to give their perspective as well as liberals.
There goes free entertainment and unbiased news.
How did the Nazis feel about the BBC? They confiscated all the radios!

posts.title: Canada invites King Charles III to open Parliament in rare move: sources
top_comments: Trump has pissed off Canada so badly they just went, “wait a minute…don’t we already have a king or some shit?”
It's a fuck you to orange man south of the border.
If this is a public announcement of the invite, they already asked and got the ok privately. This isn’t something you ask out of the blue
An attempt to strengthen ties perhaps?
Really smart. Trump seems to love Charles so why not play that angle as well as show we’re sovereign and distinct. Smart.
Ooh, will a Carney-written throne speech be in the works? Charles speaking will put a different weight on things.

> When a sovereign opens Parliament, they are the one who delivers the Speech from the Throne that outlines what the government plans for its mandate and immediate priorities.

I bet they want to put some spicy words about America in the King's speech.
Strengthen ties with The UK in light of the weakening ties with The US.

It hasn’t been discussed overmuch, but Carney has the strongest personal relationships to the British government/elite of any Canadian PM at least since Sir Charles Tupper, who spent nearly 13 years in London as Canada’s official representative to the imperial government before (briefly) becoming PM in 1896. And realistically much more than Tupper, since he occupied a crucial role within the British government itself.

I think in the current climate, it isn't a bad idea.

Trump is kind of obsessed with the monarchy, and it shows Canada has its own connections and friends, and some of them are people he wishes to emulate to a degree. Canada needs to use each tool it has right now, although I doubt we will still have a monarch in 100 years from now, we have to get through the next 4 years.

posts.title: U.S. Marine in Okinawa indicted over rape, injury
top_comments: I visited Japan back in 2019 and my cousin, who was stationed there, couldn't hang out with me until the very last day of my trip because the base had gone in to lockdown over some rapes that transpired in Okinawa.
Same old shit, different year. I remember arriving in Okinawa in 2004 right before bases went on lock down because some Air Force SSgt liked school girls.

Holy fuck shots

"We cannot help but have doubts regarding the education and management of U.S. military personnel. We strongly urge the implementation of more effective countermeasures," 

Holy fuck this guy is bonkers.

"According to the indictment, Wedington choked a female civilian worker in a base lavatory before sexually assaulting her against a stall door and then stomped on the face of the woman who tried to rescue her."

Same old shit, different year, I remember being on Oki back in 2010 and left just before the bases got locked down and drinking secured because some reserve fly boys thought consent ended at the international date line.

Walk down any strip near a base at 9pm and its embarassing how our servicemen present themselves. 

The fact he has already been handed over to Japanese authorities sounds like SOFA is being waived and he is fuuuuuucked, he will likely be charged and serve time in the Japanese criminal justice system, then be handed back over to be charged again under the UCMJ.   
  
U.S. and Japanese legal systems are considered **separate sovereigns**, so prosecution by both does **not** violate double jeopardy laws.
Does this happen more frequently in Okinawa compared to other international bases?

Fuck, man.  This shit again.  Was stationed in Japan from 08 - 14.  Towards the end of my time there, some sailors decided to rape and murder a local girl which sent the whole of Japan bases on lockdown and curfews.  This shit just keeps happening.  Fucking clowns.  To hell with this guy.
Ah yes Okinawa marines and rape. Truly a combo
So that place still the same since I was there in 2000. 7th Crime BN Csmp Hansen.
Why is it always Marines? I'm sure Army, Navy... etc are guilty as well, but it really seems 90% of issues in Okinawa are from Marines.

>U.S. Ambassador to Japan **George Glass** said in a statement that he was "disturbed" by the allegations,

posts.title: US small parcels loophole closes pushing up prices for Shein and Temu
top_comments: I just took a look at Temu and literally everything they show you now ships from a local warehouse, I wonder how long they can do that for

On one hand, Temu and Shien abused the FUCK out of this loophole and something had to be done.

On the other, wow do 200% tariffs and no exemption for small orders STING.

There's a bunch of niche hobbies that'll be affected by this. 

r/flashlights and budgetlightforum were basically purchasing from 3 small time shops direct from china. There's no US equivalent to them and a $15-30 item becomes way too much. 

DIY electronics - you could get affordable tubes, and components and chassis direct from dealers in China and get into tube amps for cheap

It's not just Chinese high volume sellers, it's everything that comes from China, including anything that could be packaged under $800 worth, including parts for machines, generic drugs, small electronics like game consoles, shoes, clothing—all of that is now essentially 3x the price. The tariffs go up to 170% plus shipping is now going way up (takes longer to process), so basically 3X on the import price. Also any American manufacturer who is lucky enough to not import parts or raw ingredients, will also jack up their price, as why not make more money. So everything is going up, which will increase inflation and ultimately cause interest rates to climb (going down now because economy is slowing).

Not just for them. I know a lot of small businesses that use this loophole. 

Even larger businesses will do this:  

Let’s say you want to test a product before you buy 20,000 of them to keep in your warehouse. Using small individual shipments is more expensive per unit, but less risky. 

This won’t just drive up prices, it will slow down business growth because testing new products in your market just got more expensive.
if this kills 'fast fashion' industries who help pollute the planet with extra plastics, oil usage, and clothing thrown into landfills, then good.

Honestly, this is one aspect of this whole mess that makes sense. De minimus was initially designed to allow people to bring gifts home from vacation or business trips duty free. It was never really necessary, but it made sense in that context. The idea that companies can use it to bring in lots of cheap crap to sell in the U.S. goes against the initial idea of the law, which was to exclude non-commercial imports from tariffs or other import duties. I don't think that these goods should be tariffed, but if you are selling something in the U.S., you should pay import duties.
Relax, you can survive on 2 dolls instead of 30. Your purchasing power may have been reduced by a factor of 15, but we have a strong economy and we're winning! /s
This may the only positive thing regarding tariffs as temu and shein are awful companies and should get no business lol

https://youtu.be/wBRVsJIPO1I

Old vid but why would anyone order from Temu even before the tariff madness?

posts.title: Army plans for a potential parade on Trump’s birthday call for 6,600 soldiers
top_comments: He's wanted this for a long time.  I agree with something John Oliver said to the effect of "yeah he'll get it and as he watches it roll by he'll think, no... this doesn't do it either.  It still doesn't fill the giant hole in me where my father's love should be."
Someone tell DOGE to look at the costs involved here!

The phrase that stuck with me when this was proposed during Trump 1.0 was "third world bullshit".  IIIRC the guy who said that also killed Bin Laden and happens to be pretty politically conservative.     

   Military specific parades\* and officers wearing huge hats are warning signs that you live in an authoritarian shit hole.    If there are any major changes to the military dress uniforms during Trump's presidency, Canada here I come.     

   

  \*Ceremonial segments of our military, like marching bands, joining other parades is 100% OK and a great way to recognize our service members.   It's rolling tanks and troops through the middle of a city that is problematic.
If not dictator, why dictator shaped
In 1775 the Army was created to take down a tyrant.  250 years later they dance for one.

TL;DR:
The Army is planning a large birthday festival for its 250th anniversary on June 14 — which is also Trump's birthday — and may add a military parade involving over 6,600 troops, 150+ vehicles, 50 helicopters, and bands. The parade is still under discussion, pending White House approval, and could cost tens of millions. Concerns include security, logistics, housing troops, and road damage from heavy vehicles. Trump has long wanted such a parade, but high costs and local objections stopped past efforts.
Waste of more money, who would have thought
Many Federal employees were fired for this.

It’s especially ironic for Trump to be planning a military parade in his honor when his best bud in Russia, Vlad, is trying to pull off exactly the same and inviting in sycophants from other obsequious countries.
Trump wants the Hitler style  parades in his honor .the man doesn’t have an ounce of humility.  I can’t believe his head hasn’t exploded by now.

posts.title: Trump shuts down program to end human waste backing into Alabama homes, calling it ‘illegal DEI’
top_comments:
“The problem has existed so long and was so pervasive that a 2017 study determined 1 in every 3 adults in the county had the intestinal parasite hookworm. “

Nice

Let me guess the program was helping minority communities (the most common community that is effected by pollution) in Alabama, but because helping minorities is ‘illegal DEI’ then it had to be removed
I guess Alabama will now be literally full of shit.

Can we focus on that "illegal DEI" comment for a moment? He's now saying that DEI is *against the law*. Not just something he wants to stop, but something that will get you thrown in jail. 

Doing anything that benefits anyone other than cis straight White men with zero disabilities is now illegal.
Apparently not drinking or bathing in water tainted with human excrement is (checks notes) *woke*.

To be extremely clear: 

The program itself has nothing to do with DEI. The program itself has nothing to do with racism.

The program is simply because 1 in 3 people there have intestinal parasitic hookworms, due to an extremely unsafe lack of proper sanitation.

The REASON this area has zero infrastructure for good sanitation is because the federal government and the state of Alabama have been extremely racist for 150 years, since black people were allowed to own land. The only place they were allowed to buy land was an area which was very low and had soil which made it basically impossible to dig sanitation infrastructure. 

On top of that, due to segregationist zoning laws and redlining, their parents and grandparents were prohibited from buying land elsewhere. 

Now, they cannot move because the land they live on is basically worthless - nobody would want to buy their property for a reasonable price - and they cannot climb out of poverty due to suppressed wages and higher medical bills - due to the lack of sanitation.

Can't sell the land, can't get better wages, can't climb out of poverty. 

This is true for all the people there, regardless of race.

So, to repeat myself: the *current program* has nothing to do with DEI and race. Everyone who lives there benefits from it.

This is  also a perfect example of Critical Race Theory - it's not about anyone *currently* being racist. It's just that centuries of racism created this situation, and we need to fix it. 

Donald Trump, and Republicans, want to get rid of it because *they* are racist, though.

Anyone noticing everything benefitting anyone other than wealthy, white, male, Christian, heterosexuals is being killed for being DEI?

They've found a way to back door discrimination.
He says “environmental justice” is a diversity, equity and inclusion program. Somehow.
Reminder that DEI is not illegal, even if that was a valid argument, which it's not.

So the federal government is shutting down a program because of the race and color of those benefitting from it.

Maybe...https://uscode.house.gov/view.xhtml?req=(title:42%20section:1983%20edition:prelim)

posts.title: Cat survives 380-foot fall that killed couple hiking in Utah's Bryce Canyon National Park, animal sanctuary says
top_comments:
>Tourists spotted the bodies Tuesday below Inspiration Point after the two fell late Monday or early Tuesday, the Garfield County Sheriff's Office said in a statement. How they fell was unknown, but they had crossed over safety railings, according to the statement.

The safety railing looks to be around 4 feet high and well maintained from some of the pictures.

So not only did they climb over a safety fence, they brought their cat with them?  Just horrible, evil shit to do.   Or at the very least, highly inconsiderate.  

Also, cats are so good at surviving things.   [This cat survived for two months in a closed shipping container](https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/12628172/miracle-cat-two-months-trappe-shipping-container-spiders/).

The cat was in a carrier. I wouldn't have been too surprised at a cat free-falling where it can orient itself. Being in a carrier meant it couldn't do that.

On the other hand, the carrier might have protected it from being scratched or impaled.
[removed]

>Nannen and Crane were living in a U-Haul van and recently spent a significant amount of time in Arizona. Florida was their last state of permanent residence, according to the sheriff's office.

Certainly paints a picture.

curiosity killed the cat

satisfaction brought him back
These people were incredibly stupid and not to mention thoughtless when it came to the safety of their pet. All for a photo!

Those were two very lucky people.

Normally people that stupid don't survive into their 40s or 50s.

I'm glad their stupidity didn't kill the cat. The cat's lucky too. Normally people that stupid aren't capable of caring for a pet either.
Yeah i read somewhere that cats can survive crazy high falls.

posts.title: US small parcels loophole closes pushing up prices for Shein and Temu
top_comments: I just took a look at Temu and literally everything they show you now ships from a local warehouse, I wonder how long they can do that for

On one hand, Temu and Shien abused the FUCK out of this loophole and something had to be done.

On the other, wow do 200% tariffs and no exemption for small orders STING.

There's a bunch of niche hobbies that'll be affected by this. 

r/flashlights and budgetlightforum were basically purchasing from 3 small time shops direct from china. There's no US equivalent to them and a $15-30 item becomes way too much. 

DIY electronics - you could get affordable tubes, and components and chassis direct from dealers in China and get into tube amps for cheap

It's not just Chinese high volume sellers, it's everything that comes from China, including anything that could be packaged under $800 worth, including parts for machines, generic drugs, small electronics like game consoles, shoes, clothing—all of that is now essentially 3x the price. The tariffs go up to 170% plus shipping is now going way up (takes longer to process), so basically 3X on the import price. Also any American manufacturer who is lucky enough to not import parts or raw ingredients, will also jack up their price, as why not make more money. So everything is going up, which will increase inflation and ultimately cause interest rates to climb (going down now because economy is slowing).

Not just for them. I know a lot of small businesses that use this loophole. 

Even larger businesses will do this:  

Let’s say you want to test a product before you buy 20,000 of them to keep in your warehouse. Using small individual shipments is more expensive per unit, but less risky. 

This won’t just drive up prices, it will slow down business growth because testing new products in your market just got more expensive.
if this kills 'fast fashion' industries who help pollute the planet with extra plastics, oil usage, and clothing thrown into landfills, then good.

Honestly, this is one aspect of this whole mess that makes sense. De minimus was initially designed to allow people to bring gifts home from vacation or business trips duty free. The idea that companies can use it to bring in lots of cheap crap to sell in the U.S. goes against the initial idea of the law, which was to exclude non-commercial imports from tariffs or other import duties. I don't think that these goods should be tariffed, but if you are selling something in the U.S., you should pay import duties.

posts.title: Alleged leaders of child exploitation cult known as 764 arrested, charged | ‘Trippy’ and ‘War’ are accused of operating 764 Inferno, an invitation-only group for top members
top_comments:
Some details:

>Two men have been arrested and charged with running an international child exploitation enterprise known as 764 which targets vulnerable minors online and coerces them to self-harm, make child sexual abuse material of themselves and participate in violent acts — including animal abuse and even suicide.
>
>Prasan Nepal, 20, who police say used the moniker "Trippy" in the 764 network, was arrested in North Carolina. Leonidas Varagiannis, a 21-year-old U.S. citizen, known as "War" was arrested in Greece, according to police. 
>
>They allegedly led a core subgroup called 764 Inferno that operated using encrypted messaging platforms. Police say the men exploited at least eight minors, some as young as 13 years old.
>
>"The information in the criminal complaint is sickening," said an online investigator named Becca who tracks 764 and shares what she learns with law enforcement. For her safety, we are only using her first name. 
>
>...
>
>According to an affidavit and criminal complaint unsealed Wednesday in the United States District Court for the District of Columbia, Nepal had been involved in 764 since its inception in 2020. He emerged as its leader in August 2021 after the founder, Bradley Cadenhead, was arrested by the FBI. 
>
>Cadenhead created 764 in 2020 at the age of 15 and named the group after his area code in Stephenville, Texas. He is serving an 80-year sentence for pleading guilty to possession with intent to promote child pornography in 2023.
>
>Varagiannis is believed to have joined in December 2023 and became a co-leader of 764 Inferno, which was reserved solely for the inner core members of 764 and was by invitation only.
>
>Nepal and Varagiannis had strict rules for joining 764, according to police. Potential members had to produce and share content that often included child sexual abuse material and images of victims self harming.  
>
>"These defendants are accused of orchestrating one of the most heinous online child exploitation enterprises we have ever encountered," said U.S. Attorney General Pamela Bondi in a media release Wednesday.
>
>Nepal and Varagiannis, along with two others, allegedly created a guide that gave prospective members instructions on how to create "content" by targeting vulnerable "e-girls," who struggled with mental illness.
>
>...
>
>The group also poses an escalating threat worldwide as it forges alliances with other violent online groups that promote mass killings and targeted attacks. 
>
>Other violent acts have been linked to 764, including a school shooting earlier this year in Nashville, stabbings last fall in Sweden and the murder of an elderly woman in Romania in 2022. 
>
>Police have also foiled deadly plots tied to the groups in the U.K. and the United States in recent months. In Italy, police arrested a member last month who they say was in the advanced stages of a plan to kill vulnerable people.

If these allegations prove true, then these are some truly despicable acts perpetrated by some heinous people.
This is some heinous Blacklist shit.

posts.title: Canada invites King Charles III to open Parliament in rare move: sources
top_comments: Trump has pissed off Canada so badly they just went, “wait a minute…don’t we already have a king or some shit?”
It's a fuck you to orange man south of the border.
If this is a public announcement of the invite, they already asked and got the ok privately. This isn’t something you ask out of the blue
An attempt to strengthen ties perhaps?
Really smart. Trump seems to love Charles so why not play that angle as well as show we’re sovereign and distinct. Smart.
Ooh, will a Carney-written throne speech be in the works? Charles speaking will put a different weight on things.

> When a sovereign opens Parliament, they are the one who delivers the Speech from the Throne that outlines what the government plans for its mandate and immediate priorities.

I bet they want to put some spicy words about America in the King's speech.
Strengthen ties with The UK in light of the weakening ties with The US.

It hasn’t been discussed overmuch, but Carney has the strongest personal relationships to the British government/elite of any Canadian PM at least since Sir Charles Tupper, who spent nearly 13 years in London as Canada’s official representative to the imperial government before (briefly) becoming PM in 1896. And realistically much more than Tupper, since he occupied a crucial role within the British government itself.

I think in the current climate, it isn't a bad idea.

Trump is kind of obsessed with the monarchy, and it shows Canada has its own connections and friends, and some of them are people he wishes to emulate to a degree. Canada needs to use each tool it has right now, although I doubt we will still have a monarch in 100 years from now, we have to get through the next 4 years.

posts.title: US small parcels loophole closes pushing up prices for Shein and Temu
top_comments: I just took a look at Temu and literally everything they show you now ships from a local warehouse, I wonder how long they can do that for

On one hand, Temu and Shien abused the FUCK out of this loophole and something had to be done.

On the other, wow do 200% tariffs and no exemption for small orders STING.

There's a bunch of niche hobbies that'll be affected by this. 

r/flashlights and budgetlightforum were basically purchasing from 3 small time shops direct from china. There's no US equivalent to them and a $15-30 item becomes way too much. 

DIY electronics - you could get affordable tubes, and components and chassis direct from dealers in China and get into tube amps for cheap

It's not just Chinese high volume sellers, it's everything that comes from China, including anything that could be packaged under $800 worth, including parts for machines, generic drugs, small electronics like game consoles, shoes, clothing—all of that is now essentially 3x the price. The tariffs go up to 170% plus shipping is now going way up (takes longer to process), so basically 3X on the import price. Also any American manufacturer who is lucky enough to not import parts or raw ingredients, will also jack up their price, as why not make more money. So everything is going up, which will increase inflation and ultimately cause interest rates to climb (going down now because economy is slowing).

Not just for them. I know a lot of small businesses that use this loophole. 

Even larger businesses will do this:  

Let’s say you want to test a product before you buy 20,000 of them to keep in your warehouse. Using small individual shipments is more expensive per unit, but less risky. 

This won’t just drive up prices, it will slow down business growth because testing new products in your market just got more expensive.
if this kills 'fast fashion' industries who help pollute the planet with extra plastics, oil usage, and clothing thrown into landfills, then good.

Honestly, this is one aspect of this whole mess that makes sense. De minimus was initially designed to allow people to bring gifts home from vacation or business trips duty free. It was never really necessary, but it made sense in that context. The idea that companies can use it to bring in lots of cheap crap to sell in the U.S. goes against the initial idea of the law, which was to exclude non-commercial imports from tariffs or other import duties. I don't think that these goods should be tariffed, but if you are selling something in the U.S., you should pay import duties.
Relax, you can survive on 2 dolls instead of 30. Your purchasing power may have been reduced by a factor of 15, but we have a strong economy and we're winning! /s
This may the only positive thing regarding tariffs as temu and shein are awful companies and should get no business lol

posts.title: Marshall man whose student visa was revoked remains detained
top_comments:

>I understand you’re making an argument with an eye toward fairness, and I understand that the respondent has garnered a significant amount of media attention, and I understand there are very sympathetic circumstances in his case,” Mazzie said. “The most hefty factor is that the respondent is detained at government expense. My termination of the case would be inappropriate.

Is it the way the article quotes her, or is she saying the government's wallet is more important than this man's freedom?

This is past the scary point. We need to be angry, strategic and strength bonds of solidarity.
